content:
I'd be happy to help you plan some healthy breakfast options for the week ahead.

Since you already have a great breakfast routine going with oatmeal, banana, and honey, I'll suggest some variations and additions to keep your mornings interesting and nutritious. Here's a 7-day meal plan with healthy breakfast ideas:

**Monday**

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with sliced banana, honey, and chopped walnuts (add some crunch and healthy fats)
* Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with quinoa and steamed veggies
* Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans

**Tuesday**

* Breakfast: Avocado toast on whole-grain bread with scrambled eggs and cherry tomatoes
* Lunch: Turkey and avocado wrap with mixed greens and whole-grain tortilla
* Dinner: Grilled turkey burger with roasted veggies and brown rice

**Wednesday**

* Breakfast: Greek yogurt parfait with granola, sliced banana, and a sprinkle of cinnamon
* Lunch: Chicken Caesar salad with whole-grain croutons
* Dinner: Slow-cooked lentil soup with whole-grain bread

**Thursday**

* Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with frozen berries, Greek yogurt, spinach, and almond milk topped with sliced almonds and chia seeds
* Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with mixed greens and whole-grain pita
* Dinner: Quinoa and black bean bowl with roasted veggies and a drizzle of balsamic glaze

**Friday**

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with sliced banana, honey, and a sprinkle of cinnamon (back to your classic!)
* Lunch: Tuna salad sandwich on whole-grain bread with mixed greens
* Dinner: Grilled shrimp with roasted asparagus and quinoa

**Saturday**

* Breakfast: Breakfast burrito with scrambled eggs, black beans, and avocado wrapped in a whole-grain tortilla
* Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with mixed greens and whole-grain wrap
* Dinner: Baked chicken thighs with roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes

**Sunday**

* Breakfast: Breakfast quesadilla with scrambled eggs, black beans, and salsa wrapped in a whole-grain tortilla
* Lunch: Turkey and cheese sandwich on whole-grain bread with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Slow-cooked chicken and vegetable stew with whole-grain bread

Feel free to swap out ingredients or interchange different protein sources to keep things interesting. You can also adjust the portion sizes based on your personal needs. 

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any dietary restrictions or preferences. Enjoy your meal prep!
